message_1:
A company manufactures a product and records the number of units sold each month over the past year. The data is given in the table below:

| Month | Units Sold |
|-------|------------|
| Jan   | 150        |
| Feb   | 140        |
| Mar   | 170        |
| Apr   | 210        |
| May   | 250        |
| June  | 300        |
| July  | 330        |
| Aug   | 290        |
| Sep   | 240        |
| Oct   | 200        |
| Nov   | 160        |
| Dec   | 140        |

Determine the following statistics for this time series data: 

1. Mean 
2. Median 
3. Mode 
4. Range 
5. Standard deviation 

Round your answers to two decimal places.
message_2:
To calculate the statistics, we first need to organize the data:

Units Sold: 140, 140, 150, 160, 170, 200, 210, 240, 250, 290, 300, 330

1. Mean:
(140 + 140 + 150 + 160 + 170 + 200 + 210 + 240 + 250 + 290 + 300 + 330) / 12 = 2470 / 12 = 205.83

Mean = 205.83

2. Median:
Since there are 12 data points, the median will be the average of the 6th and 7th values.

(200 + 210) / 2 = 410 / 2 = 205

Median = 205

3. Mode:
The mode is the value that appears most frequently in the data set. In this case, the value 140 appears twice, while all other values appear only once.

Mode = 140

4. Range:
The range is the difference between the highest and lowest values in the data set.

Range = 330 - 140 = 190

5. Standard deviation:
First, we need to find the variance. To do this, we calculate the average of the squared differences between each data point and the mean.

[(140 - 205.83)^2 + (140 - 205.83)^2 + (150 - 205.83)^2 + ... + (330 - 205.83)^2] / 12

[(-65.83)^2 + (-65.83)^2 + (-55.83)^2 + ... + (124.17)^2] / 12

[4335.89 + 4335.89 + 3116.89 + ... + 15416.09] / 12

[104080.96] / 12 = 8665.08 (variance)

Now, we take the square root of the variance to find the standard deviation.

Standard deviation = âˆš8665.08 = 93.08

So, the statistics for this time series data are:

1. Mean: 205.83
2. Median: 205
3. Mode: 140
4. Range: 190
5. Standard deviation: 93.08
